title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
rrodriguez left at 00:20 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
jvelo joined #xwiki at 00:32

sdumitriu - (01:25): cjdelisle`: Busy?  
cjdelisle` - (01:31): nope  
sdumitriu - (01:33): Can you help me with something? Try using the 3.3.2 version of Hibernate http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/hibernate/hibernate-core/ and run this query:  
cjdelisle` - (01:33): ...?  
sdumitriu - (01:34): #foreach($r in $xwiki.search("select cast(act.date as date), act.page, max(act.date) from ActivityEventImpl as act group by cast(act.date as date), act.page order by 3 desc", 30, 0))  
cjdelisle` - (01:35): What is it complaining about?  
sdumitriu - (01:35): It fails because it doesn't know the type of the cast result  
sdumitriu - (01:35): Which should be already fixed http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/hibernate/browse/HHH-592  
sdumitriu - (01:36): But doesn't work with our current 3.2.6  
cjdelisle` - (01:37): How does 3.3.2 work with XWiki?  
cjdelisle` - (01:37): Are there any major issues to face when upgrading?  
sdumitriu - (01:38): It's split into more modules  
sdumitriu - (01:38): I think you need to use another module for caching and one for connection pooling as well  
sdumitriu - (01:39): Pick from here http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/hibernate/  
cjdelisle` - (01:40): To implement multiple databases in postgres we'll have to be able to have multiple pools.  
jvelo joined #xwiki at 01:43  
cjdelisle` - (02:05): I got to get to bed. Wild guess is that something is up with the "group by cast(act.date as date)" since that has to be done in the database.  
cjdelisle` - (02:05): I'll look at it again tomorrow.

sburjan - (11:15): vmassol: I have a question. I want to finish the patch for IRCbot. And regarding the translation for the LiveTable I did on xwiki.org. Is there any way to import a XAR that has a translations page and that page to be added automatically to the rights page ? Is there a backend mechanism that does that for imported XAR's ?  
sburjan - (11:16): because if the user has to add the Translations page to Rights, that is too much and we loose the "upload->import->install" .. and I'd rather not do it in this case  
vmassol - (11:17): sburjan: not right now  
vmassol - (11:17): ATM it's part of the installation instructions  
sburjan - (11:17): okay. so I won't do it. Too much trouble to get a LivePage header look nice  
sburjan - (11:17): \*LiveTable  
vmassol - (11:18): errr?  
vmassol - (11:18): please add the translation page  
vmassol - (11:18): if the user doesn't add it it doesn't matter  
sburjan - (11:18): okay  
sburjan - (11:18): if you want it, I'll add it  
vmassol - (11:18): you won't have nice headers in any case  
vmassol - (11:19): personally I wouldn't have added translations at all  
vmassol - (11:19): but since you've done it  
vmassol - (11:19): ...  
vmassol - (11:19): anyway up to you  
sburjan - (11:23): well I can not include that page in the patch :)

sdumitriu - (16:40): Hm, there's a critical regression in 2.7  
sdumitriu - (16:41): Importing the XAR in an empty database will save all documents as XWikiGuest  
sdumitriu - (16:41): Which means that all macros and all skin extensions won't be available  
sdumitriu - (16:41): This is caused by the import bugfix  
abusenius - (16:43): vmassol: hm, solving this use case would mean defining an explicit way around a security measure :)  
tmortagne - (16:44): sdumitriu: so before the fix it was not possible to import as non-backup pack and now it's impossible to import as backup pack ?

cjdelisle` - (21:48): My little theory on why they are all 8192bytes is that the server file IO hanged and the attachments could only save to memory. When a fileitem becomes larger than 10k it is persisted to the disk. Because the buffers used for copying were 4096b, the attachments all stopped at 8192.  
vmassol - (21:48): cjdelisle`: there's probably a bug when a failure happens on the path somewhere  
vmassol - (21:49): (yep something like that)  
vmassol - (21:49): since you introduced disk io, that's a new point of failure so we need to handle potential sync issues  
cjdelisle` - (21:50): It is indeed a bug in terms of not being ACID but it is not a huge regression blocking copying of documents.  
cjdelisle` - (21:50): Perhaps it should be checking that the data is actually saved.

sdumitriu - (23:18): This has to do with Raluca's mail  
sdumitriu - (23:18): [xwiki-devs] [Activity Stream Plugin][Proposal] Modify or depricate searchUniquePages() method  
sdumitriu - (23:18): "What searchUniquePages() method should actually return is the list of unique pages GROUPED and ordered BY DAY."  
sdumitriu - (23:19): Group by day means using only the date part of event.date, droping the time information  
sdumitriu - (23:19): This can be done in four ways  
sdumitriu - (23:20): 1. Use year(), month(), day() in the query, which works, but is not so good for performance  
sdumitriu - (23:20): 2. Use cast(evt.date as date) which apparently doesn't work in the version of hibernate we're using  
sdumitriu - (23:21): 3. Use date(evt.date) which works in mysql, but not in the version of hibernate dialect for hsqldb that we're using  
sdumitriu - (23:21): 4. Store the date in the activity stream as well, which means duplicate data in the database  
cjdelisle` - (23:21): re #2. You upgraded and it still didn't work, am I correct?  
sdumitriu - (23:21): For the moment I think the fastest implementation is 1
